intro: Tragia urticifolia var. texana, commonly known as Texas pricklyweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to dry climates and it is sometimes used in xeriscaping.
